result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward A. Schierland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Paid in full.  Taken out of cash bond posted.
Paid in full.  Taken out of cash bond posted.
Defendant shall maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination thereof.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall take medication only as prescribed.
Defendant shall use only one pharmacy and report any new medications to Agent within 72 hours.
Defendant shall complete an alcohol and drug assessment and complete treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall comply with mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment.
Defendant shall complete a cognitive intervention program.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Portage County Case 14CF471 and any other sentence he is serving.

Statement by defendant
Sentenced to prison for 6 1/2 years with 3 1/2 years initial confinement followed by 3 years of extended supervision - concurrent with Portage County Case 14CF471
Conditions of extended supervision:
Pay costs, including $90.00 buy money - joint and several with Josh Parker
Maintain absolute sobriety
Take medication only as prescribed
Use only one pharmacy and report any new medications to Agent within 72 hours
Complete an alcohol and drug assessment and complete treatment recommendations
